meanings.definition: To punch holes in something before it is needed.
meanings.sent1: I will prepunch the papers for the binder later.
meanings.sent2: She always prepunches the documents before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that she was prepunching the papers to stay ahead of the game.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous prepunching of the cards ensured they fit perfectly in the album.
meanings.sent5: The sound of prepunching echoed through the office, signaling the start of the project.

meanings.definition: The act of punching holes in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prepunching of the tickets saved time at the event entrance.
meanings.sent2: We noticed the prepunching on the cards for the craft project.
meanings.sent3: The prepunching machine hummed along, creating a rhythmic pattern in the room.
meanings.sent4: The prepunching process was like a dance, each hole perfectly placed.
meanings.sent5: The prepunching of the fabric made sewing the buttons much easier.
